clip_assessment.verbatim_quote: This is what your house is for. This is what all the sacrifices have been for.
clip_assessment.guest_voice: Karina speaks with quiet conviction and practical wisdom ‚Äî she educates without preaching, using real stories to illustrate principles.
clip_assessment.why_this_stops_scrolls: It reframes homeownership from transaction to life-changing security ‚Äî something agents forget when they're stuck in the grind.

HOOK.text: Your clients don't actually understand what they bought.
HOOK.production_note: Text on screen: 'Your clients don't understand...' Over B-roll of keys being handed over at closing

SETUP.text: Karina Chavez ‚Äî top 1% producer in Albuquerque ‚Äî watched the 2008 crash destroy her community. Interest-only loans. Predatory lenders. Families who thought they understood, but didn't.
SETUP.production_note: Quick cuts of Karina speaking, then archival footage of foreclosure signs from 2008

INSIGHT.text: So now? She prints every loan document. Goes page by page. Fixed rate ‚Äî it never changes. Taxes. Insurance. Everything. Not because she's a loan officer. Because she learned something most agents miss: Your job isn't done at closing. One of her clients called her years later, panicking about a medical crisis. Karina reminded her: 'This is what your house is for. This is what all the sacrifices have been for.' Equity. Security. A way forward.
INSIGHT.production_note: Split screen: Karina explaining documents on one side, then cut to emotional moment of her recounting the story. Text overlay on 'This is what your house is for'

REFRAME.text: You're not selling houses. You're selling the thing that catches people when they fall. But only if they actually understand what they own. That's the difference between a transaction and a relationship that lasts decades.
REFRAME.production_note: Karina speaking directly to camera, intimate framing

CTA.text: Ask yourself: Could your clients explain their mortgage to their kids? If not, you're leaving them vulnerable. Full episode ‚Äî link in bio.
